page.title: 18MONZIE ESTATE
page.content: Monzie castle and part of the estate are situated in the most western region of our area. The entire estate covers 1750 hectares and is inherited by Mr Macgill-Crighton-Stuart. 20 people are employed on the estate running both the farm and the joinery. 90% of the estate is used for farming most of which is upland and hill farming. The main farming activity is the rearing of lambs and suckled calves. The joinery is a new venture for the estate using wood from Scandinavia and the U.S.A. The produce is sold to the Scottish domestic market with very little being exported. The estate also has its own electricity and water supply, with the excess being sold to the grid. There is also grouse shooting on the estate but lately there have been few grouse.
